attributes.action: Regulate couriers or offer a choice to online consumers
attributes.additional_details:
Online polls highlight that consumers in the UK are dissatisfied with the service provided by couriers. The following statistics are taken from Trustpilot:
DPD has a poor rating. Of 15,061 reviews, 58% of customers rate the service they received as poor or bad.
Parcel Force has a poor rating. Of 6,013 reviews, 68% of customers rate the service they received as poor or bad. 
Yodel has an average rating. Of 60,672 reviews, 35% of customers rate the service they received as poor or bad.
attributes.background: Couriers are unregulated in the United Kingdom. Complaints to couriers can be rejected with no further action or compensation. Consumers in the UK are not provided with a choice of courier when placing an online order. We should be protected from a poor service, loss or damage.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the regulation of couriers, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You'll need to give your full name to start a petition.
